creator: igotimac@gmail.com
text:
I just wanted to let you know that the Chainsaw at:
http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/webstart/chainsaw/chainsaw.dmg
does not work with Zeroconf

while the Chainsaw at:
http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/webstart/chainsaw/chainsaw-bundle.zip
does work

I think you need to update the OS X version you are providing with the latest jars in chainsaw-bundle.zip

creator: natkins@sidestep.com
text:
Major feature is broken, increasing severity.  I tried putting the chainsaw jar
file in $HOME/Library/Java and it still did not find it.

Did you see http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=41239 - looks like
there was a problem with the dmg (missing zeroconf jar).  This has been fixed
and a new dmg uploaded - please try and report back.
creator: sdeboy@iname.com

text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Did you see http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=41239 - looks like
> there was a problem with the dmg (missing zeroconf jar).  This has been fixed
> and a new dmg uploaded - please try and report back.
> 
> 

Yes, I think the new .dmg distribution should work much better.  Be keen to see
if it does for you.
creator: psmith@apache.org
psmith@apache.org
text:
I have confirmed that the online .dmg version does indeed now ship with the
log4j-zeroconf.jar bundled inside, so I believe this is fixed.

Please re-open if it is not working for you.
